meanings.definition: To make or become wider or larger
meanings.sent1: She used a special tool to dilatate the hole in the wall.
meanings.sent2: The balloon started to dilatate as more air was blown into it.
meanings.sent3: Trying to fit into his old jeans, he wished he could dilatate his waist magically.
meanings.sent4: Her heart dilatated with joy when she saw her long-lost friend.
meanings.sent5: The river seemed to dilatate as it flowed through the valley, embracing the land around it.

meanings.sent1: The yoga instructor asked the class to dilatate their arms during the stretch.
meanings.sent2: The fabric will dilatate when pulled gently from both ends.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to dilatate its body to fit through the narrow gap in the fence.
meanings.sent4: His mind began to dilatate with new ideas as he explored the possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The universe continues to dilatate, revealing more of its vastness to us.

meanings.definition: To increase in size or volume
meanings.sent1: The cake batter will dilatate as it bakes in the oven.
meanings.sent2: The population of the city began to dilatate rapidly due to immigration.
meanings.sent3: The rumor started to dilatate, growing more exaggerated with each retelling.
meanings.sent4: Her smile dilatated across her face as she received the good news.
meanings.sent5: The excitement in the room seemed to dilatate, filling every corner with energy.
